info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cleveland, southwestern Gaston, northwestern York and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Shelby, or near Patterson Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Kings Mountain, South Gastonia, Clover, Blacksburg, Grover, Patterson Springs, Earl, Smyrna and Kings Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
